<title level="1" right="Background " pfs="">[Wanderlust](/Backgrounds.aspx?ID=348)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Rare" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=137" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Gatewalkers Player's Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=190) pg. 8

 

</column>

You've traveled the world for years in search of excitement and adventure. On the night of the Missing Moment, all the many exciting occasions you've experienced paled in comparison to the vision of fantastic lands and incredible people you saw on the other side of the glowing gate. You stepped through in the hopes of finally reaching the thrilling highs you so desperately seek, but as soon as you'd gone there you were again, standing in front of a lightless gateway with a months-long gap in your memories. Frustrated at having come so close to achieving your dreams, you swung at a nearby tree, smashing it to splinters with surprising strength you never knew you had. This strange new brawn wasn't what you asked for—but it might help you pursue the excitement you crave.

 Your [deviant abilities](/Rules.aspx?ID=1718) are of the [troll classification](/DeviantFeats.aspx?ID=2). You gain the [Titan Swing](/Feats.aspx?ID=3785) deviant feat. As a quirk, whenever you use a deviant ability, your feet elongate and your leg bones crack as your lower limbs transform into those of a rabbit, wolf, or other spry, long-heeled animal.

Choose two attribute boosts. One must be to Dexterity
or Intelligence, and one is a free attribute boost.

You're trained in the [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=10) skill, and the [Stabling Lore](/skills/lore) skill. You gain the [Express Rider](/Feats.aspx?ID=2126) skill feat.
name: Wanderlust
